page.title: 03The Tower of St.Cleer Church
page.content: The tower is 97 feet high. There are 69 narrow, dusty, stone steps. On the first floor is the clock chamber which has the clock mechanism. There are two clocks outside on the south and west sides. The bell ropes pass through the second floor. On the third floor there are 6 bells made of cast iron. Some of them were made in a field nearby. When we got to the top of the steps there was a small door. The roof is covered with lead. It slopes in the middle so that the rain can drain away. There are scratched initials from hundreds of years ago. There are crosses on top of four pinnacles, and 20 battlements. In the ringing chamber there is a trap door to open to make the sound of the bells louder. There is a hook for the captain of the Tower to hook the ropes on so that they do not hang down when they are not being used.
